column1: S207F.CARD.  1. CARD ONE
S207F.DECK.  207. SURVEY NUMBER
S207F.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.

S207F.Q1. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE ARMY? E. IF YOU HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY BEFORE, THEN WERE OUT FOR A WHILE, JUST CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOU ENTERED THIS LAST TIME. IF YOU WERE IN THE NATIONAL GUARD, CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOUR OUTFIT CAME INTO THE ARMY.  1. 6 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 6 MONTHS UP TO 1 YEAR 3. OVER 1 YEAR UP TO 2 YEARS 4. OVER 2 YEARS UP TO 3 YEARS 5. OVER 3 YEARS UP TO 5 YEARS 6. OVER 5 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q2. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN YOUR PRESENT GROUP?  1. ONE MONTH OR LESS 2. OVER ONE MONTH UP TO 2 MONTHS 3. OVER 2 MONTHS UP TO 3 MONTHS 4. OVER 3 MONTHS UP TO 6 MONTHS 5. OVER 6 MONTHS UP TO 1 YEAR 6. OVER ONE YEAR 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q3. WHEN WERE YOU BORN?  01. 1926 - 18 YEARS OLD 02. 1925 - 19 YEARS OLD 03. 1924 - 20 YEARS OLD 04. 1923 - 21 YEARS OLD 05. 1922 - 22 YEARS OLD 06. 1921 - 23 YEARS OLD 07. 1920 - 24 YEARS OLD 08. 1919 - 25 YEARS OLD 09. 1915-1918 - 26-29 YEARS OLD 10. 1910-1914 - 30-34 YEARS OLD 11. 1909 AND BEFORE - 35 YEARS OLD AND OVER 00. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q4. ARE YOU:  1. SINGLE 2. MARRIED 3. DIVORCED OR SEPARATED 4. WIDOWED 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q5. WHAT IS YOUR MAIN FLYING DUTY?  01. AIRPLANE COMMANDER 02. PILOT 03. NAVIGATOR 04. BOMBARDIER 05. RADAR OBSERVER 06. ENGINEER 07. RADIO OPERATOR 08. TAIL GUNNER 09. CFC GUNNER 10. BLISTER GUNNER 00. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q6. WHAT IS YOUR RANK OR GRADE?  01. MAJOR 02. CAPTAIN 03. 1ST LIEUTENANT 04. 2ND LIEUTENANT 05. FLIGHT OFFICER 06. MASTER SERGEANT 07. TECHNICAL SERGEANT 08. STAFF SERGEANT 09. SERGEANT 10. CORPORAL 11. PRIVATE FIRST CLASS OR PRIVATE 00. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q7. HOW LONG HAVE YOU HELD YOUR PRESENT RANK?  1. 3 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 3 MONTHS UP TO 6 MONTHS 3. OVER 6 MONTHS UP TO 9 MONTHS 4. OVER 9 MONTHS UP TO 12 MONTHS 5. OVER 12 MONTHS UP TO 18 MONTHS 6. OVER 18 MONTHS UP TO 24 MONTHS 7. OVER 24 MONTHS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q8A. SO FAR AS YOU KNOW, WHAT IS THE HIGHEST RANK A MAN CAN HOLD FOR THE JOB YOU ARE NOW DOING IN YOUR PRESENT CREW?  01. PRIVATE FIRST CLASS OR PRIVATE 02. CORPORAL 03. BUCK SERGEANT 04. STAFF SERGEANT 05. TECHNICAL SERGEANT 06. MASTER SERGEANT 07. FLIGHT OFFICER 08. 1ST LIEUTENANT 09. 2ND LIEUTENANT 10. CAPTAIN 11. MAJOR 12. HIGHER THAN MAJOR 00. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q8B. WHAT DO YOU THINK THE TOP RANK REALLY SHOULD BE? (IF YOU THINK THE ONE YOU MARKED IN THE LAST QUESTION IS O.K., CHECK IT AGAIN BELOW. IF YOU THINK IT SHOULD BE HIGHER OR LOWER, CHECK WHAT YOU THINK IT SHOULD BE.)  01. PRIVATE FIRST CLASS OR PRIVATE 02. CORPORAL 03. BUCK SERGEANT 04. STAFF SERGEANT 05. TECHNICAL SERGEANT 06. MASTER SERGEANT 07. FLIGHT OFFICER 08. 1ST LIEUTENANT 09. 2ND LIEUTENANT 10. CAPTAIN 11. MAJOR 12. HIGHER THAN MAJOR 00. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q9. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT YOUR PRESENT CHANCES FOR PROMOTION?  1. VERY WELL SATISFIED 2. FAIRLY WELL SATISFIED 3. SOMEWHAT DISSATISFIED 4. VERY DISSATISFIED 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q10. HOW DO YOU THINK THE MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT ARE SELECTED FOR PROMOTION?  1. BECAUSE OF ABILITY 2. BOOTLICKING OR PLAYING POLITICS 3. LUCK 4. BEEN IN THE ARMY A LONG TIME 5. AUTOMATIC ("UP TO T/O LIMITS," "MASS PROMOTION," "UP TO WHATEVER THE JOB CALLS FOR"; LENGTH OF TIME IN GRADE, UNIT, ETC.; OPENINGS IN RATINGS) 6. OTHER 7. MISCELLANEOUS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q11. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF THE WORK YOU ARE DOING RIGHT NOW AS COMPARED WITH OTHER JOBS YOU MIGHT BE DOING IN THE ARMY?  1. IT IS AS IMPORTANT AS ANY OTHER JOB I COULD DO 2. IT IS FAIRLY IMPORTANT, BUT I COULD DO MORE IMPORTANT WORK 3. IT HARDLY SEEMS IMPORTANT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q12. DOES THE ARMY JOB YOU NOW HAVE GIVE YOU A CHANCE TO USE YOUR SKILL AND EXPERIENCE?  1. A VERY GOOD CHANCE 2. A FAIRLY GOOD CHANCE 3. NOT MUCH OF A CHANCE 4. NO CHANCE AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q13. WOULD YOU CHANGE TO SOME OTHER ARMY JOB IF GIVEN A CHANCE?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q14. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF WORK YOU HAVE TO DO?  1. I HAVE TOO MUCH TO DO, BUT MOST OF IT IS NECESSARY 2. I HAVE TOO MUCH TO DO AND A LOT OF IT IS UNNECESSARY 3. I HAVE ABOUT THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF WORK TO DO 4. I AM NOT KEPT VERY BUSY, BUT I DON'T MIND SITTING AROUND 5. I DON'T HAVE ENOUGH TO DO, AND IT GETS PRETTY TIRESOME SITTING AROUND 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q15. IN GENERAL, HOW WELL DO YOU LIKE WORKING IN YOUR PRESENT ARMY JOB?  1. I REALLY ENJOY MY WORK VERY MUCH 2. I LIKE IT FAIRLY WELL 3. I DISLIKE IT A LITTLE 4. I DISLIKE IT VERY MUCH 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q16. HAVE YOU EVER SERVED IN THE ARMY OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES IN THIS WAR? (DON'T COUNT TRAINING TRIPS LIKE GYPSY) Z. EDIT "YES" TO "NO" IF MAN INDICATES THAT HIS ONLY OVERSEAS EXPERIENCE IS PUERTO RICO, BORINQUEN FIELD, OR OTHER SUCH OVERSEAS TRAINING MISSIONS. SOME MEN CALL IT "GYPSY".  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q17. HAVE YOU BEEN IN ACTUAL COMBAT OR UNDER ENEMY FIRE IN THIS WAR?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q18. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT SERVING OVERSEAS?  1. I WANT TO GET OVERSEAS AS SOON AS POSSIBLE 2. I'M READY TO GO WHENEVER I'M NEEDED 3. I'D LIKE TO STAY IN THE U.S. FOR A FEW MONTHS, BUT THEN I'LL BE READY TO GO ANYWHERE 4. I DON'T WANT TO GO OVERSEAS 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q19. IF AND WHEN YOU GET INTO COMBAT HOW WELL DO YOU THINK YOU WILL STAND UP UNDER BATTLE CONDITIONS?  1. VERY WELL 2. FAIRLY WELL 3. NOT VERY WELL 4. NOT WELL AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q20. ABOUT HOW MUCH LONGER DO YOU THINK THE WAR WILL LAST WITH JAPAN?  01. LESS THAN 6 MONTHS 02. EXACTLY 6 MONTHS 03. MORE THAN 6 MONTHS UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 1 YEAR 04. EXACTLY 1 YEAR 05. MORE THAN 1 YEAR UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 18 MONTHS 06. EXACTLY 18 MONTHS (1 1/2 YEARS) 07. OVER 18 MONTHS UP TO 2 YEARS 08. EXACTLY 2 YEARS 09. OVER 2 YEARS UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 3 YEARS 10. 3 YEARS OR MORE 00. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q21. HOW IMPORTANT A PART DO YOU THINK B-29,S WILL PLAY IN WINNING THE WAR?  1. A VERY IMPORTANT PART 2. A FAIRLY IMPORTANT PART 3. NOT A VERY IMPORTANT PART 4. NOT IMPORTANT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q22. DO YOU EVER GET THE FEELING THAT THIS WAR IS NOT WORTH FIGHTING?  1. VERY OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONLY ONCE IN A GREAT WHILE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q23. HOW MANY OF YOUR SQUADRON OFFICERS ARE THE KIND THAT ALWAYS TRY TO LOOK OUT FOR THE WELFARE OF ENLISTED MEN?  1. NONE 2. FEW 3. ABOUT HALF 4. MOST 5. ALL 6. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q24. DO YOU FEEL YOU REALLY BELONG IN YOUR SQUADRON AND ARE AN IMPORTANT PART OF IT?  1. VERY MUCH SO 2. FAIRLY MUCH SO 3. NOT VERY MUCH 4. NOT AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q25. IN GENERAL DO YOU THINK THAT THE ENLISTED MEN IN YOUR PRESENT SQUADRON GET A SQUARE DEAL FROM THEIR SQUADRON OFFICERS?  1. YES, IN MOST WAYS THEY DO 2. IN SOME WAYS, YES, IN OTHER WAYS, NO 3. NO, ON THE WHOLE THEY DO NOT GET A SQUARE DEAL 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q26. IN GENERAL, DO YOU FEEL YOU YOURSELF HAVE GOTTEN A SQUARE DEAL FROM THE ARMY?  1. YES, IN MOST WAYS I HAVE 2. IN SOME WAYS, YES, IN OTHER WAYS, NO 3. NO, ON THE WHOLE I HAVE NOT GOTTEN A SQUARE DEAL 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q27. CONSIDERING THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES, HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE PRIVILEGES THAT OFFICERS GET COMPARED WITH ENLISTED MEN?  1. FAR TOO MANY PRIVILEGES COMPARED WITH ENLISTED MEN 2. A FEW TOO MANY PRIVILEGES COMPARED WITH ENLISTED MEN 3. ABOUT THE RIGHT NUMBER OF PRIVILEGES 4. TOO FEW PRIVILEGES 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q28A....THE MEDICAL SERVICE YOU ARE GETTING?  1. ABOUT AS GOOD AS IT COULD BE UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 2. COULD BE IMPROVED BUT IT WOULDN'T MAKE TOO MUCH DIFFERENCE TO ME 3. COULD BE IMPROVED AND IT WOULD HELP A LOT IF IT WERE 4. UNCERTAIN 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q28B....THE RECREATIONAL FACILITIES AT THIS BASE?  1. ABOUT AS GOOD AS THEY COULD BE UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 2. COULD BE IMPROVED BUT IT WOULDN'T MAKE TOO MUCH DIFFERENCE TO ME 3. COULD BE IMPROVED AND IT WOULD HELP A LOT IF IT WERE 4. UNCERTAIN 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q28C....THE FOOD AT YOUR MESS?  1. ABOUT AS GOOD AS IT COULD BE UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 2. COULD BE IMPROVED BUT IT WOULDN'T MAKE TOO MUCH DIFFERENCE TO ME 3. COULD BE IMPROVED AND IT WOULD HELP A LOT IF IT WERE 4. UNCERTAIN 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 29 AND 30 NOT CODED.

S207F.Q31. HOW MUCH DOES IT BOTHER YOU WHEN YOU ARE ORDERED TO DO THINGS WHICH YOU DON'T SEE A GOOD REASON FOR DOING?  1. BOTHERS ME A GREAT DEAL 2. BOTHERS ME QUITE A BIT 3. DOESN'T BOTHER ME MUCH 4. DOESN'T BOTHER ME AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q32. WHAT DO YOU THINK OF THE MILITARY CONTROL AND DISCIPLINE AT THIS BASE?  1. IT'S TOO STRICT BUT MOST OF IT IS NECESSARY 2. IT'S TOO STRICT AND A LOT OF IT IS UNNECESSARY 3. IT'S ABOUT RIGHT 4. IT'S NOT STRICT ENOUGH 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q33. IN GENERAL, HOW DOES YOUR BOMB GROUP GET ALONG WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AT THIS BASE?  1. VERY WELL 2. FAIRLY WELL 3. NOT VERY WELL 4. VERY POORLY 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q34. HOW SUCCESSFUL ARE YOUR SQUADRON OFFICERS IN GETTING WILLING AND WHOLE-HEARTED COOPERATION FROM THE MEN?  1. VERY SUCCESSFUL 2. FAIRLY SUCCESSFUL 3. NOT VERY SUCCESSFUL 4. UNSUCCESSFUL 5. NOT SURE 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q35. DO YOU FEEL YOUR SUPERIOR OFFICERS KNOW WHAT YOUR ABILITIES ARE AND WHAT YOU ARE ABLE TO DO?  1. THEY HAVE A GOOD IDEA 2. THEY HAVE A FAIR IDEA 3. THEY KNOW LITTLE OR NOTHING ABOUT MY ABILITIES 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q36. ARE YOU USUALLY TOLD WHY THE THINGS THAT ARE DONE IN YOUR SQUADRON ARE NECESSARY?  1. ALMOST ALWAYS 2. USUALLY 3. ABOUT HALF THE TIME 4. USUALLY NOT 5. ALMOST NEVER 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q37. IN GENERAL ARE YOU GLAD YOU ARE IN A B-29 OUTFIT OR WOULD YOU RATHER BE IN SOME OTHER TYPE OF OUTFIT?  1. PREFER B-29 OUTFIT 2. B-17 3. B-24 4. ALL OTHER "B'S" (BOMBERS) 5. ALL "A" SHIPS, SUCH AS A-26 (ATTACK) 6. ALL "P" SHIPS, (PURSUIT OR FIGHTER) 7. ALL OTHER SPECIFIED (MISCELLANEOUS) 8. OTHER (NOT SPECIFIED) 9. MAKES NO DIFFERENCE 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q38. YOU WILL PROBABLY WANT TO TAKE A VACATION FIRST OF ALL AFTER YOU GET OUT OF THE ARMY. BUT AFTER THAT, WHICH ONE OF THE THINGS BELOW DO YOU THINK YOU ARE MOST LIKELY TO DO? (CHECK ONLY ONE - THE THINGS YOU THINK YOU ARE MOST LIKELY TO DO FIRST, EVEN IF YOU SHOULD PLAN TO CHANGE TO SOMETHING ELSE AFTERWARD.)  1. WORK FOR AN EMPLOYER, ON SALARY, WAGES OR COMMISSION 2. GO TO FULL-TIME SCHOOL OR COLLEGE 3. FARM 4. HAVE MY OWN BUSINESS 5. I PLAN TO STAY IN THE ARMY 6. I'M UNDECIDED WHAT I WILL DO 7. ALL DOUBLE CHECKS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q39. HOW FAR DID YOU GO IN SCHOOL?  1. LESS THAN 6TH GRADE 2. FINISHED 6TH GRADE 3. FINISHED 7TH GRADE 4. FINISHED 8TH GRADE 5. SOME HIGH SCHOOL BUT DID NOT FINISH 6. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 7. SOME COLLEGE BUT DID NOT FINISH 8. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE (EDUCATION BEYOND COLLEGE) 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q40A1....LENGTH OF BRIEFINGS?  1. TOO LONG 2. TOO SHORT 3. ABOUT RIGHT 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q40A2....INFORMATION GIVEN AT BRIEFINGS?  1. TOO MUCH UNNECESSARY INFORMATION 2. NOT ENOUGH INFORMATION 3. ABOUT THE RIGHT AMOUNT 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q40A3....THE WAY INFORMATION IS PRESENTED AT BRIEFINGS?  1. WELL PRESENTED 2. POORLY PRESENTED 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 40B NOT CODED.
S207F.Q41. ON THE WHOLE, HOW IS THE MORALE OF THE FLIERS IN YOUR SQUADRON?  1. VERY HIGH 2. HIGH 3. JUST SO-SO 4. LOW 5. VERY LOW 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  1. COMPLAINTS ABOUT UTILIZATION OF TIME (BAD SCHEDULING OF FLIGHTS, "SWEATING" OUT PLANES, WANTS TO DECIDE FOR SELF HOW TO WASTE TIME SINCE IT MUST BE WASTED); MORE LEISURE TIME 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  93 1. ALL GROUND SCHOOL COMPLAINTS (SCHOOL NO GOOD, JUST A TIME KILLING DEVICE, REPETITION OF SCHOOLING) 2061 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  254 1. PASS SITUATION BAD (OUGHT TO BE EASIER TO GET, AT LEAST ONE SUNDAY EVERY 2 WEEKS, ETC.) 1900 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  664 1. COMPLAINTS ON RATINGS AND PROMOTIONS (T/O NOT HIGH ENOUGH, ETC.) 1490 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  127 1. RECREATION AND SPORTS SHOULD BE IMPROVED (P.T. NOT GOOD, SPORTS PROGRAM INSTEAD) 2027 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  90 1. IMPROVE RELATIONS BETWEEN OFFICERS AND ENLISTED MEN (MORE PARTIES, GET TOGETHERS) 2064 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  168 1. FOOD NOT SATISFACTORY (IN-FLIGHT LUNCHES, PX NOT GOOD, HOT AND COLD DRINKS WHILE IN AIR) 1986 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  109 1. KEEP MEN INFORMED (DON'T KNOW WHAT GOES ON AND WHY); LENGTH OF TOUR 2045 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  70 1. COMPLAINTS OF AIRPLANE MAINTENANCE PLM 2084 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  454 1. INEFFICIENCY OF GROUP OPERATION: MEN NOT HANDLED FAIRLY; GIVE PRAISES WHEN DUE; GIVE MEN MORE RESPONSIBILITY; LESS RED TAPE; COOPERATION BETWEEN FLIGHT AND GROUND 1700 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  746 1. MISCELLANEOUS 1408 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q42. WHAT TWO THINGS DO YOU THINK WOULD DO THE MOST GOOD TO IMPROVE THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR SQUADRON?  184 1. NO ANSWER 1970 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q43. IF IT WERE UP TO YOU TO CHOOSE, DO YOU THINK YOU COULD DO MORE FOR YOUR COUNTRY AS A SOLDIER OR AS A WORKER IN A WAR JOB?  1. AS A SOLDIER 2. AS A WAR WORKER 3. UNDECIDED 4. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S207F.Q44. DO YOU EVER GET THE FEELING THAT YOU WILL NOT BE AS GOOD A COMBAT FLIER AS THE OTHER MEN ON YOUR CREW?  1. I ALMOST NEVER FEEL THAT WAY 2. I FEEL THAT WAY ONLY ONCE IN A GREAT WHILE 3. I FEEL THAT WAY FAIRLY OFTEN 4. I FEEL THAT WAY NEARLY ALL OF THE TIME 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q45. IF YOU WERE ON A LONG MISSION AND IF FLYING AND COMBAT CONDITIONS PERMITTED, DO YOU THINK YOU WOULD BE ABLE TO SLEEP?  1. YES, I'M SURE I COULD 2. NO, I DON'T THINK I COULD 3. I CAN'T SAY 4. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
S207F.Q46A. FLYING OVER MOUNTAINS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q46B. FLYING OVER WATER?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q46C. TAKE-OFFS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q46D. LANDINGS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q46E. TROUBLE WITH PRESSURIZED CABINS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER X. COL. 80 NOT USED. CARD 2
S207F.CARD.  2. CARD TWO
S207F.DECK.  207. SURVEY NUMBER
S207F.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.
S207F.Q46F. FLYING FORMATION THROUGH HEAVY CLOUDS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q46G. NIGHT FLYING?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q46H. FLYING IN BAD WEATHER?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q47A. THE THOUGHT OF DITCHING?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q47B. THE THOUGHT OF CRASH LANDING?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q47C. THE THOUGHT OF GETTING LOST?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q47D. THE THOUGHT OF ENGINE FAILURE?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q47E. THE THOUGHT OF FIRE ON THE SHIP?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q47F. THE THOUGHT OF BAILING OUT?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q48. SO FAR AS YOU KNOW, WILL YOU GET ALL THE FIGHTER ESCORT YOU NEED WHEN YOUR GROUP IS IN COMBAT?  1. YES, I THINK WE WILL 2. NO, I DOUBT IF WE WILL 3. I CAN'T SAY ONE WAY OR THE OTHER 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q49. DO YOU EVER WORRY WHETHER YOU WILL BE INJURED IN COMBAT BEFORE THE WAR IS OVER?  1. NEVER WORRY ABOUT IT 2. HARDLY EVER WORRY ABOUT IT 3. WORRY ABOUT IT FAIRLY OFTEN 4. WORRY ABOUT IT VERY OFTEN 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  1. NOT BOTHERED IN PARTICULAR (WILL WORRY LATER; THIS IS WAR; THEY SHOOT LIVE AMMO; THEY TRY TO KILL YOU) 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  902 1. SUICIDE ATTACKS (KAMAKAZE) (RAMMING IN MID-AIR) 1252 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  578 1. TREATMENT OF PRISONERS (TORTURING, ATROCITIES, CONCENTRATION CAMPS, BEING CAPTURED, BAD TREATMENT) 1576 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  119 1. KILLING PRISONERS (BEHEADING, DECAPITATING) 2035 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  29 1. FRONTAL OR NOSE ATTACKS (OUT OF THE SUN) 2125 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  26 1. AIR TO AIR BOMBING 2128 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  108 1. MISCELLANEOUS 2046 2. NOT CHOSEN
S207F.Q50. ARE THERE ANY TACTICS OR PRACTICES OF THE JAPANESE THAT PARTICULARLY BOTHER YOU?  386 1. NO ANSWER 1768 2. NOT CHOSEN

S207F.Q51. IF IT WERE UP TO YOU, WHAT KIND OF ARMY JOB WOULD YOU RATHER HAVE?  1. FLYING JOB HERE IN THE UNITED STATES 2. GROUND JOB IN THE UNITED STATES 3. GROUND JOB OVERSEAS 4. FLYING COMBAT OVERSEAS 5. FLYING NON-COMBAT OVERSEAS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q52A. AS A KID HOW INTERESTED WERE YOU IN AIRPLANES, COMPARED TO OTHER KIDS?  1. MUCH MORE INTERESTED THAN MOST KIDS 2. SOMEWHAT MORE INTERESTED 3. ABOUT THE SAME AS OTHER KIDS 4. LESS INTERESTED THAN OTHER KIDS 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q52B. DID YOU EVER FLY AS A PILOT OR PASSENGER BEFORE ENTERING THE ARMY?  1. YES, A GOOD DEAL 2. YES, SOME 3. NO, NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q52C. HOW DID YOU FEEL ABOUT FIGHTING AS A KID?  1. DIDN'T LIKE FIGHTING AT ALL 2. DIDN'T PARTICULARLY LIKE OR DISLIKE IT 3. REALLY LIKED FIGHTING 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q53. DID YOU VOLUNTEER OR WERE YOU ASSIGNED TO B-29,S?  1. I VOLUNTEERED FOR B-29,S 2. I WAS ASSIGNED TO B-29,S 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q54A. WERE YOU EVER ELIMINATED OR WASHED OUT AT ANY STAGE OF AIR CADET TRAINING?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q54B. IF YES, HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT IT NOW?  1. I AM JUST AS WELL SATISFIED 2. I AM SOMEWHAT DISSATISFIED WITH THE DEAL I GOT 3. I AM VERY DISSATISFIED WITH THE DEAL I GOT 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q55. HOW DO YOU THINK YOUR SQUADRON STACKS UP WITH THE OTHER SQUADRONS IN YOUR BOMB GROUP?  1. AT LEAST AS GOOD AS THE OTHERS 2. PROBABLY BETTER THAN THE OTHERS 3. MUCH BETTER THAN THE OTHERS 4. NOT AS GOOD AS THE OTHERS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q56. IF YOU HAD TO BE TRANSFERRED TO ANOTHER SQUADRON IN YOUR GROUP, WHICH ONE WOULD YOU PICK?  1. 461ST SQUADRON 2. 462ND SQUADRON 3. 463RD SQUADRON 4. 847 5. NONE, NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S207F.Q57. HOW DOES YOUR BOMB GROUP STACK UP WITH OTHER B-29 BOMB GROUPS THAT YOU KNOW ABOUT?  1. AT LEAST AS GOOD AS OTHERS 2. PROBABLY BETTER THAN OTHERS 3. MUCH BETTER THAN OTHERS 4. NOT AS GOOD AS OTHERS 5. I DON'T KNOW ANYTHING ABOUT ANY OTHER BOMB GROUPS 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q58A. VIOLENT POUNDING OF THE HEART?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q58B. SINKING FEELING IN THE STOMACH?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q58C. FEELING OF WEAKNESS OR FEELING FAINT?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q58D. FEELING SICK AT THE STOMACH?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
S207F.Q58E. COLD SWEAT?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
S207F.Q58F. VOMITING?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q58G. SHAKING OR TREMBLING ALL OVER?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
S207F.Q58H. FEELING OF STIFFNESS?  1. OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ONCE 4. NEVER 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
S207F.Q59. IN YOUR OPINION, DOES YOUR AIRPLANE COMMANDER KNOW HIS STUFF?  1. YES, VERY WELL 2. YES, FAIRLY WELL 3. NO, HE DOES NOT 4. I AM THE AIRPLANE COMMANDER 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q60. HOW DOES YOUR AIRPLANE COMMANDER COMPARE WITH MOST OF THE OTHER AIRPLANE COMMANDERS YOU KNOW?  1. MUCH BETTER THAN MOST 2. SOMEWHAT BETTER THAN MOST 3. AS GOOD AS MOST 4. NOT AS GOOD AS MOST 5. I AM THE AIRPLANE COMMANDER 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q61. HOW MANY HOURS HAVE YOU FLOWN WITH YOUR PRESENT AIRPLANE COMMANDER? (A/C'S OMIT ANSWERING THIS)  1. 0 - 39 HOURS 2. 40 - 79 HOURS 3. 80 - 119 HOURS 4. 120 - 159 HOURS 5. 160 - 199 HOURS 6. 200 - 239 HOURS 7. 240 HOURS AND OVER 0. DON'T KNOW, NO ANSWER
S207F.Q62. DOES YOUR NAVIGATOR SEEM TO KNOW HIS STUFF?  1. YES, VERY WELL 2. YES, FAIRLY WELL 3. NO, HE DOES NOT 4. I AM THE NAVIGATOR 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q63. IN YOUR OPINION, HOW WELL DO THE GROUND CREWS OF THE GROUP KNOW THEIR STUFF?  1. VERY WELL 2. FAIRLY WELL 3. NOT VERY WELL 4. NOT WELL AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q64. ARE YOU IN A LEAD CREW AT PRESENT?  1. YES 2. NO 3. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q65. DO YOU THINK YOU WOULD WANT TO BE IN A LEAD CREW WHEN FLYING IN COMBAT?  1. YES, VERY MUCH 2. YES, THAT WOULD BE ALL RIGHT 3. IT DOES NOT MATTER WHETHER I'M IN THE LEAD CREW OR NOT 4. I WOULD RATHER NOT BE IN THE LEAD CREW 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q66. SO FAR AS YOU KNOW, WHAT WILL PROBABLY BE THE ONE MOST IMPORTANT REASON FOR SELECTING THE AIRPLANE COMMANDERS OF THE LEAD CREWS IN COMBAT?  1. TOTAL HOURS OF FLYING TIME 2. RANK 3. POLITICS 4. PERFORMANCE IN TRAINING OR COMBAT 5. SOMETHING ELSE 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S207F.Q67. HOW DO YOU THINK OTHER MEMBERS OF THE LEAD CREWS WILL BE SELECTED?  1. TOTAL HOURS OF FLYING TIME 2. RANK 3. POLITICS 4. PERFORMANCE IN TRAINING OR COMBAT 5. IT ALL DEPENDS ON HOW YOUR PRESENT A/C MAKES OUT 6. SOMETHING ELSE 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q68A. ABOUT HOW MANY COMBAT MISSIONS DO YOU THINK HEADQUARTERS WILL EXPECT YOUR CREW TO FLY IN THE PACIFIC?  1. 15 MISSIONS OR UNDER 2. 20 MISSIONS 3. 25 MISSIONS 4. 30 MISSIONS 5. 35 MISSIONS 6. 40 MISSIONS 7. 45 MISSIONS 8. 50 MISSIONS 9. OVER 50 MISSIONS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q68B. HOW MANY COMBAT MISSIONS DO YOU THINK A MAN IN YOUR JOB CAN FLY BEFORE HE SHOULD BE TAKEN OFF OPERATIONS OR ROTATED?  1. 15 MISSIONS OR UNDER 2. 20 MISSIONS 3. 25 MISSIONS 4. 30 MISSIONS 5. 35 MISSIONS 6. 40 MISSIONS 7. 45 MISSIONS 8. 50 MISSIONS 9. OVER 50 MISSIONS 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q68C. WHAT IS THE GREATEST NUMBER OF COMBAT MISSIONS YOU THINK YOU COULD FLY IN ONE MONTH AND STILL DO YOUR JOB O.K.  01. UNDER 4 MISSIONS 02. 4 - 5 MISSIONS 03. 6 - 7 MISSIONS 04. 8 - 9 MISSIONS 05. 10 - 11 MISSIONS 06. 12 - 13 MISSIONS 07. 14 - 15 MISSIONS 08. 16 - 17 MISSIONS 09. 18 - 19 MISSIONS 10. OVER 19 MISSIONS 00. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q69D. HOW MANY DAYS IN A ROW DO YOU THINK YOU COULD FLY IN COMBAT AND STILL DO YOUR JOB O.K. IF YOU GOT ONLY FIVE HOURS SLEEP EACH DAY?  01. 1 DAY 02. 2 DAYS 03. 3 DAYS 04. 4 DAYS 05. 5 DAYS 06. 6 DAYS 07. 7 DAYS 08. 8 DAYS 09. 9 DAYS 10. 10 DAYS 11. MORE THAN 10 DAYS 00. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q69. DO YOU THINK YOU COULD FLY ON A COMBAT MISSION THAT KEPT YOU AWAKE FOR 24 HOURS AND STILL DO YOUR JOB O.K.*  1. YES, I'M SURE I COULD 2. YES, I THINK SO 3. I'M NOT SURE THAT I COULD 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q70A. ARE THERE ANY MEMBERS OF YOUR CREW WHO HAVE BEEN IN AERIAL COMBAT IN THIS WAR?  1. YES 2. NO 3. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S207F.Q70B. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT HAVING FLIERS WHO HAVE BEEN IN COMBAT AS MEMBERS OF YOUR CREW?  1. IT WOULD BE BETTER IF WE HAD MORE COMBAT RETURNEES IN OUR CREW 2. I WOULD RATHER NOT HAVE COMBAT RETURNEES IN OUR CREW 3. IT DOESN'T MATTER 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q71. DO YOU THINK YOUR PRESENT CREW IS PROGRESSING AS WELL AS CAN BE EXPECTED IN THEIR TRAINING FOR COMBAT?  1. YES, DOING VERY WELL 2. YES, COMING ALONG O.K. 3. NO, NOT DOING AS WELL AS COULD BE EXPECTED 4. NO, DOING POORLY 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q72. SO FAR AS YOU KNOW, IS YOUR TRAINING THE KIND YOU WILL ACTUALLY NEED IN COMBAT?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q73. DO YOU THINK TOO MUCH TRAINING TIME HAS BEEN SPENT IN CERTAIN ASPECTS OR PHASES OF YOUR TRAINING?  1. YES 2. NO 3. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S207F.Q76. SO FAR AS YOU KNOW, WILL YOUR FLY-AWAY B-29,S BE AS EASY TO MAINTAIN UNDER COMBAT CONDITIONS AS ARE THE LATEST B-17,S?  1. THE LATEST B-29,S WILL BE EASIER TO MAINTAIN THAN THE 17,S 2. JUST AS EASY TO MAINTAIN AS 17,S 3. SOMEWHAT HARDER TO MAINTAIN THAN 17,S 4. MUCH HARDER TO MAINTAIN THAN 17,S 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q77. IF THE JAPANESE WERE TO OFFER TO STOP FIGHTING NOW AND TO GIVE UP ALL THE COUNTRIES AND TERRITORY THEY HAVE TAKEN OVER, WHAT DO YOU THINK WE SHOULD DO?  1. WE SHOULD ACCEPT THE OFFER AND STOP FIGHTING NOW 2. WE SHOULD CONSIDER THE OFFER AND TRY TO WORK OUT SOME PEACE TERMS WITH THEM 3. WE SHOULD TURN DOWN THE OFFER AND KEEP ON FIGHTING UNTIL THEY GIVE UP COMPLETELY 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q78A. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE JAPANESE AFTER THE WAR?  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY JAPANESE 2. PUNISH THE ORDINARY JAPANESE PEOPLE AS WELL AS THE LEADERS 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE JAPANESE NATION 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q78B. WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE HAPPEN TO THE GERMANS NOW THAT THE WAR IS OVER?  1. PUNISH THE LEADERS, BUT NOT THE ORDINARY GERMANS 2. PUNISH THE ORDINARY GERMAN PEOPLE AS WELL AS THE LEADERS 3. WIPE OUT THE WHOLE GERMAN NATION 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q79. DO YOU THINK JAPAN WILL GIVE UP AND SURRENDER ON OUR TERMS BEFORE THEY LOSE EVERYTHING OR DO YOU THINK THEY WILL KEEP RIGHT ON FIGHTING TO THE VERY END?  1. THEY WILL GIVE UP AND SURRENDER 2. THEY WILL KEEP RIGHT ON FIGHTING TO THE VERY END 3. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S207F.Q80. DO YOU AGREE OR DISAGREE WITH THE IDEA THAT THE JAP PILOTS ARE GOOD FIGHTERS AND VERY HARD TO DEFEAT?  1. I AGREE, THE JAP IS A GOOD PILOT AND VERY HARD TO DEFEAT 2. I AGREE THAT THE JAP IS A GOOD PILOT BUT HE'S NOT TOO HARD TO DEFEAT 3. I DISAGREE, HE'S NOT A GOOD PILOT AND NOT TOO HARD TO DEFEAT 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q81. WHICH COMES CLOSEST TO YOUR IDEA OF HOW HARD IT IS GOING TO BE TO BEAT THE JAPANESE?  1. IT WILL NOT BE VERY HARD 2. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB BUT OUR LOSSES WON'T BE TOO HEAVY 3. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, WITH HEAVY LOSSES OF MEN AND EQUIPMENT 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q82. DO THE MEN IN YOUR CREW COOPERATE AND WORK WELL TOGETHER?  1. ALL OF THE TIME 2. MOST OF THE TIME 3. OFTEN DO NOT 4. ALMOST NEVER DO 0. NO ANSWER
S207F.Q83. HOW MANY OF THE MEN IN YOUR PRESENT CREW WOULD YOU SAY KNOW THEIR STUFF?  1. ALL 2. MOST 3. ABOUT HALF 4. ONLY A FEW 5. ALMOST NONE 0. NO ANSWER

S207F.Q84. IF AND WHEN YOU GET INTO COMBAT HOW DO YOU THINK YOUR PRESENT CREW WILL STAND UP UNDER COMBAT CONDITIONS?  1. VERY WELL 2. FAIRLY WELL 3. NOT VERY WELL 4. NOT WELL AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER *****************************PART TWO***************************
